skill.name: pymatgen
skill.description: Materials science toolkit. Crystal structures (CIF, POSCAR), phase diagrams, band structure, DOS, Materials Project integration, format conversion, for computational materials science.
skill.summary: Materials science toolkit. Crystal structures (CIF, POSCAR), phase diagrams, band structure, DOS, Ma...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns were found. Network access is limited to Materials Project API use, and credential handling is limited to reading MP_API_KEY from the environment.

content.value_statement: Materials analysis is slow when tools are scattered and formats break. This skill streamlines conversion, analysis, and phase diagrams with trusted pymatgen tools.
actual_capabilities: Convert structure files between CIF, POSCAR, XYZ, JSON, and other formats
Analyze symmetry, lattice parameters, and coordination environments
Export structure analysis to JSON or YAML files
Generate phase diagrams using Materials Project entries
Analyze stability and decomposition for specific compositions
Save phase diagram plots to PNG, PDF, or SVG
limitations: Requires local installation of pymatgen and its dependencies
Phase diagram generation requires MP_API_KEY and mp-api
Interactive plotting requires a GUI-capable environment
Distance matrix output is limited to structures with 20 atoms or fewer

use_cases.title: Rapid structure vetting
use_cases.description: Check symmetry, density, and coordination for candidate structures before running expensive calculations.

use_cases.title: Format conversion at scale
use_cases.description: Batch convert CIF or POSCAR files to the formats required by different simulation codes.

use_cases.title: Phase stability screening
use_cases.description: Generate phase diagrams and assess stability for target compositions from Materials Project data.

prompt_templates.title: Convert structure file
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a new file format
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert my POSCAR file to CIF and save it as structure.cif. Use the provided conversion script.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze symmetry basics
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze structure.cif with symmetry and neighbors enabled. Summarize space group, crystal system, and coordination.

prompt_templates.title: Export analysis report
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the structure analyzer on POSCAR and export the results to analysis.json in the current folder.

prompt_templates.title: Phase diagram study
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a phase diagram for Li-Fe-O and analyze the stability of LiFeO2. Save the plot as li_fe_o.png.

output_examples.input: Analyze POSCAR with symmetry and neighbors, then export to JSON.
output: Reported formula, lattice parameters, density, and symmetry summary
Listed coordination numbers for each site

best_practices: Use Structure.from_file for automatic format detection
Set MP_API_KEY before phase diagram queries
Export analysis outputs for reproducible reporting
anti_patterns: Running phase diagram generation without an API key
Assuming interactive plots work in headless environments
Using distance matrix output for large structures

faq.question: Is this compatible with latest pymatgen releases?
faq.answer: It is designed for pymatgen 2024.x and later, but older versions may work with reduced features.

faq.question: What are the main limits of the analysis scripts?
faq.answer: They rely on pymatgen and are focused on structure analysis, not full workflow automation.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with other tools?
faq.answer: Yes. Outputs are standard formats like CIF, JSON, and POSCAR for easy integration.

faq.question: Does it access or send my local data?
faq.answer: Only files you provide are read, and network access is limited to Materials Project queries.

faq.question: What should I do if a structure fails to load?
faq.answer: Verify the file format and try explicit format options in pymatgen.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic chemistry tools?
faq.answer: It focuses on materials science workflows with pymatgen and Materials Project integration.
